verses.text: And he brought out of him a merciful man, Which found favour in the sight of all flesh, \add Even\add* Moses, beloved of God and men, Whose memorial \add is\add* blessed.
He made him like to the glorious saints, And magnified him, so that \add his\add* enemies stood in fear \add of him\add*.
By his words he caused the wonders to cease, And he made him glorious in the sight of kings, \add And\add* gave him a commandment for his people, And shewed him \add part\add* of his glory.
He sanctified him in his faithfulness and meekness, \add And\add* chose him out of all men.

He made him to hear his voice, And brought him into the dark \add cloud\add*, And gave him commandments before \add his\add* face, \add Even\add* the law of life and knowledge, That \add he\add* might teach Jacob \add his\add* covenants, And Israel his judgments.
He exalted Aaron, a holy \add man\add* like unto him, \add Even\add* his brother, of the tribe of Levi.
An everlasting covenant he made with him, And gave him the priesthood among the people; He beautified him with comely ornaments, And clothed him with a robe of glory.
He put upon him perfect glory; And strengthened him with rich garments, \add With\add* breeches, with a long robe, and the ephod.

And he compassed him with pomegranates, \add And\add* with many golden bells round about, That as he went there might be a sound, \add And\add* a noise made that might be heard in the temple, For a memorial to the children of his people;
With a holy garment, with gold, and blue \add silk\add*, And purple, the work of the embroiderer, With a breastplate of judgment, \add and\add* with Urim and Thummim;

With twisted scarlet, the work of the cunning workman, With precious stones graven like seals, \add And\add* set in gold, the work of the jeweller, With a writing engraved for a memorial, After the number of the tribes of Israel.
\add He set\add* a crown of gold upon the mitre, Wherein was engraved Holiness, An ornament of honour, a costly work, The desires of the eyes, goodly \add and\add* beautiful.
Before him there were none such, Neither did \add ever any\add* stranger put \add them\add* on, But only his children And his children’s children perpetually.
Their sacrifices shall be wholly consumed every day twice continually.

Moses consecrated him, and anointed him with holy oil: \add This\add* was appointed unto him by an everlasting covenant, And to his seed, so long as the heavens should remain, That \add they\add* should minister unto him, and execute the office of the priesthood, And bless the people in his name.
He chose him out of all \add men\add* living To offer sacrifices to the Lord, Incense, and a sweet savour, for a memorial, To make reconciliation for his people.
He gave unto him his commandments, \add And\add* authority in the statutes of judgments, That \add he\add* should teach Jacob the testimonies, And inform Israel in his laws.
Strangers conspired together against him, And maligned him in the wilderness, \add Even\add* the men that were of Dathan’s and Abiron’s side, And the congregation of Core, with fury and wrath.
\add This\add* the Lord saw, and it displeased him, And in \add his\add* wrathful indignation were they consumed: He did wonders upon them, to consume them with the fiery flame.
But he made Aaron more honourable, And gave him an heritage, And divided unto him the firstfruits of the increase; Especially he prepared bread in abundance:
For they eat \add of\add* the sacrifices of the Lord, Which he gave unto him and his seed.
Howbeit in the land of the people he had no inheritance, Neither had he \add any\add* portion among the people: For \add the Lord\add* himself \add is\add* his portion and inheritance.

The third in glory \add is\add* Phinees the son of Eleazar, Because he had zeal in the fear of the Lord, And stood \add up\add* with good courage of heart when the people were turned \add back\add*, And made reconciliation for Israel.

Therefore was there a covenant of peace made with him, That \add he\add* should be the chief of the sanctuary and of his people, \add And\add* that he and his posterity should have the dignity of the priesthood for ever:

According to the covenant \add made\add* with David son of Jesse, of the tribe of Juda, \add That\add* the inheritance of the king \add should be\add* to \add his\add* posterity alone: \add So\add* the inheritance of Aaron \add should\add* also \add be\add* unto his seed.
\add God\add* give you wisdom in your heart To judge his people in righteousness, That their good \add things\add* be not abolished, And \add that\add* their glory \add may endure\add* for ever.
